gauzy: A gauzy thing looks light and thin, like a piece of gauze.
A gauzy surface is covered with a thin layer of fabric, often sheer or transparent.
meshed: The definition of meshed is stretched or interwoven.
A meshed texture is a texture that has a lot of small holes or spaces in it.
cracked: A cracked pattern is a type of pattern where there are many small cracks throughout the design.
A "cracked" thing can look like many different things.
stratified: A "stratified" object is somewhat like a laminated object, in that it is composed of a series of thin layers.
A stratified surface is one that has been divided into layers.
scaly: A scaly surface is an area of skin that is covered in scales.
A scaly material usually has a rough, dry texture with small scales that can be flaked or peeled off.
swirly: I cannot answer this question with any certainty.
The appearance of swirly material varies depending on the specific material in question.
perforated: "Perforated" material is a type of material that has small holes in it.
A "perforated" texture looks like a hole has been punched through the fabric.
pleated: A pleated texture has small, equal-sized folds arranged close together.
A "pleated" pattern has folds or creases in it.
flecked: A flecked material has small, irregular pieces of a different color throughout it.
A flecked object has small pieces of another material mixed in with it.
fibrous: Fibrous textures look stringy, like fibers.
A "fibrous" surface is one that is covered in small, thin fibers.
polka-dotted: A polka-dotted surface looks like it has small, round spots on it.
A polka-dotted texture is a texture that has many small, round dots.
chequered: A chequered surface is a surface that has a pattern of squares or rectangles on it.
likes A chequered thing has a pattern of different colors, typically black and white.
blotchy: There isn't a definitive answer to this question since the word "blotchy" can mean different things to different people.
A blotchy texture can look like a series of flat patches that are different colors.
stained: Stained materials are usually darker than the surrounding material, although the exact color can vary.
A stained pattern can look like a smudge, a discoloration, or a small spot.
crystalline: A "crystalline" thing looks smooth, reflective, and gem-like.
A crystalline object is usually transparent or translucent, with a geometric shape.
porous: A porous thing is usually full of small holes.
A "porous" thing has many small holes in it.
banded: The word "banded" can refer to something that is striped or has a series of bands or markings around it.
A banded surface is a surface that is made up of a series of bands, or stripes.
lacelike: A lacelike texture looks like a piece of lace.
A lacelike thing looks like a piece of lace.
sprinkled: An object that has been sprinkled has had a light shower of something, usually water or powder.
A "sprinkled" texture looks like a series of small dots or droplets.
bubbly: Bubbly material is typically light and frothy in appearance.
A bubbly surface is a surface that has a lot of small bubbles on it.
lined: A lined pattern is usually a series of parallel lines.
Lined material is one that has a second layer of fabric sewn on the inside.
veined: A veined surface is a surface with a pattern of lines or streaks that resemble veins.
A veined object differs from a non-veined object in that it has a network of raised lines running across its surface.
bumpy: A bumpy object is one that has a lot of bumps on it.
Bumpy material has an uneven surface, with raised and lowered areas.
paisley: Paisley material typically features a repeating pattern of curved shapes.
Paisley textures are typically ornate and detailed, with intricate designs that resemble curved leaves or flower petals.
potholed: Potholed patterns typically have a repeating motif of some sort, often geometric, and look like they have been "pocked" with holes.
Potholing is a method of underground mining in which narrow shafts are dug outward from an existing opening.
waffled: A "waffled" surface has a series of indentations that resemble a waffle.
A waffled pattern has a textured surface that resembles a waffle.
pitted: A pitted material has small indentations on its surface.
A pitted pattern is a raised, rounded pattern that is found on the surface of a material.
frilly: A frilly texture can look like a series of small ruffles or waves.
A frilly pattern features lots of small, intricate details.
spiralled: A spiralled object has a helix shape.
A spiralled object has a helix shape.
knitted: A knitted surface has a series of small loops that are interconnected.
A knitted texture looks like a series of interlocking loops.
grooved: "Grooved" can mean different things depending on the context, but typically a grooved texture is one that has parallel lines running across it.
A grooved thing usually has a long, narrow depression running along its length.
dotted: A dotted texture would have small, raised dots all over the surface.
A dotted material has a pattern of small dots.
interlaced: A "interlaced" object is an object that has a pattern of crossing lines.
A interlaced pattern looks like a series of lines that cross each other.
crosshatched: Crosshatched material typically has a pattern of parallel lines that intersect at right angles.
A crosshatched surface is a surface that has been covered with a series of crossed lines.
wrinkled: Wrinkled material generally looks like it has been crumpled up.
When an object is wrinkled, it has many lines or creases in it.
smeared: A smeared surface has a thin, even coating of something.
When something is smeared, it is usually spread out over a surface in a thin layer.
striped: A "striped" object can have many different appearances, but a common theme is that the object has lines or stripes running along its surface.
A "striped" surface has parallel lines running across it.
braided: "Braided" material often looks like a series of intertwined ropes or strips of fabric.
A braided object has three or more strands woven together in a diagonal pattern.
freckled: Freckled material can look like any other type of material with small spots or discolorations.
A freckled texture generally looks like a small, dark spot on the surface of something.
cobwebbed: "Cobwebbed" material is usually covered in a layer of dust or spider webs.
A "cobwebbed" object is covered in a thin layer of spider webs.
honeycombed: A honeycombed object has a lot of small, hexagonal spaces.
A honeycombed pattern looks like a series of small, hexagonal cells.
woven: Woven fabric has a flat surface with no piles.
Woven material looks like a piece of fabric with a weave pattern.
matted: A matted texture is a texture that is rough and tangled.
A matted object is covered in a dense, tangled mass of something.
zigzagged: A zigzagged surface looks like it has a lot of angular shapes sticking out from it.
A zigzag is a sharp change in direction.
marbled: In general, "marbled" material has a streaked or mottled appearance, like that of marble.
When something is marbled, it has a swirl of colors throughout it, kind of like how marble looks.
studded: Studded material often looks like it has metal spikes sticking out of it.
Studded material typically has small metal or plastic studs affixed to the surface.
grid: "Grid" material is typically a black, plastic material that has a honeycomb-type structure.
The grid pattern is a consistent, repeating pattern of squares (or other shapes) that are evenly spaced apart.
